ideology-question: Oppression by corporations is more of a concern than oppression by governments.
ideology-question: It is necessary for the government to intervene in the economy to protect consumers.
ideology-question: The freer the markets, the freer the people.
ideology-question: It is better to maintain a balanced budget than to ensure welfare for all citizens.
ideology-question: Publicly-funded research is more beneficial to the people than leaving it to the market.
ideology-question: Tariffs on international trade are important to encourage local production.
ideology-question: From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs.
ideology-question: It would be best if social programs were abolished in favor of private charity.
ideology-question: Taxes should be increased on the rich to provide for the poor.
ideology-question: Inheritance is a legitimate form of wealth.
ideology-question: Basic utilities like roads and electricity should be publicly owned.
ideology-question: Government intervention is a threat to the economy.
ideology-question: Those with a greater ability to pay should receive better healthcare.
ideology-question: Quality education is a right of all people.
ideology-question: The means of production should belong to the workers who use them.
ideology-question: The United Nations should be abolished.
ideology-question: Military action by our nation is often necessary to protect it.
ideology-question: I support regional unions, such as the European Union.
ideology-question: It is important to maintain our national sovereignty.
ideology-question: A united world government would be beneficial to mankind.
ideology-question: It is more important to retain peaceful relations than to further our strength.
ideology-question: Wars do not need to be justified to other countries.
ideology-question: Military spending is a waste of money.
ideology-question: International aid is a waste of money.
ideology-question: My nation is great.
ideology-question: Research should be conducted on an international scale.
ideology-question: Governments should be accountable to the international community.
ideology-question: Even when protesting an authoritarian government, violence is not acceptable.
ideology-question: My religious values should be spread as much as possible.
ideology-question: Our nation's values should be spread as much as possible.
ideology-question: It is very important to maintain law and order.
ideology-question: The general populace makes poor decisions.
ideology-question: Physician-assisted suicide should be legal.
ideology-question: The sacrifice of some civil liberties is necessary to protect us from acts of terrorism.
ideology-question: Government surveillance is necessary in the modern world.
ideology-question: The very existence of the state is a threat to our liberty.
ideology-question: Regardless of political opinions, it is important to side with your country.
ideology-question: All authority should be questioned.
ideology-question: A hierarchical state is best.
ideology-question: It is important that the government follows the majority opinion, even if it is wrong.
ideology-question: The stronger the leadership, the better.
ideology-question: Democracy is more than a decision-making process.
ideology-question: Environmental regulations are essential.
ideology-question: A better world will come from automation, science, and technology.
ideology-question: Children should be educated in religious or traditional values.
ideology-question: Traditions are of no value on their own.
ideology-question: Religion should play a role in government.
ideology-question: Churches should be taxed the same way other institutions are taxed.
ideology-question: Climate change is currently one of the greatest threats to our way of life.
ideology-question: It is important that we work as a united world to combat climate change.
ideology-question: Society was better many years ago than it is now.
ideology-question: It is important that we maintain the traditions of our past.
ideology-question: It is important that we think in the long term, beyond our lifespans.
ideology-question: Reason is more important than maintaining our culture.
ideology-question: Drug use should be legalized or decriminalized.
ideology-question: Same-sex marriage should be legal.
ideology-question: No cultures are superior to others.
ideology-question: Sex outside marriage is immoral.
ideology-question: If we accept migrants at all, it is important that they assimilate into our culture.
ideology-question: Abortion should be prohibited in most or all cases.
ideology-question: Gun ownership should be prohibited for those without a valid reason.
ideology-question: I support single-payer, universal healthcare.
ideology-question: Prostitution should be illegal.
ideology-question: Maintaining family values is essential.
ideology-question: To chase progress at all costs is dangerous.
ideology-question: Genetic modification is a force for good, even on humans.
ideology-question: We should open our borders to immigration.
ideology-question: Governments should be as concerned about foreigners as they are about their own citizens.
ideology-question: All people - regardless of factors like culture or sexuality - should be treated equally.
ideology-question: It is important that we further my group's goals above all others.
